title: 8th Pay Commission For Govt Employees, Pensioners Gets Cabinet Approval | Check Details - News18
summary:
8th Pay Commission For Govt Employees, Pensioners Gets Cabinet Approval | Check Details

Publication Date: January 16, 2025

Source: News18

The Union Cabinet has approved the constitution of the 8th Central Pay Commission, which will submit its report by 2026, impacting over one crore government employees and pensioners.

  • The 8th Pay Commission will officially start on January 1, 2026.
  • Over 50 lakh central government employees and 65 lakh pensioners will benefit from the new pay structure.
  • There is potential for a 186% salary increase, speculated to raise minimum salaries from Rs 18,000 to Rs 51,480.
  • Implementation of this commission is expected to boost economic growth and improve the quality of life for government employees.
“This will provide a significant boost to the Consumption and economic growth, along with improved quality of life for govt employees.”

The establishment of the 8th Pay Commission comes just ahead of the Union Budget 2025-26 and marks an important step in salary adjustments for government workers.
newTitle: Cabinet Approves 8th Pay Commission for Government Employees and Pensioners

In defence of Rahul Gandhi’s ‘Indian State’ remark, Congress plays Article 12 card - ThePrint
summary:
Congress Defends Rahul Gandhi's Remarks on 'Indian State'

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: New Delhi

The Congress party defended Rahul Gandhi against criticism for his comments about 'fighting the Indian state', referencing Article 12 of the Indian Constitution to clarify his statements about institutional capture by the ruling BJP and RSS.

  • Rahul Gandhi stated that the Congress is fighting against not only the BJP and RSS, but the broader Indian state.
  • Former Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel supported Gandhi’s remarks, emphasizing the capture of institutions meant to uphold justice and democracy.
  • Baghel criticized government institutions for being misused by the ruling party, citing the Election Commission and other agencies as examples.
  • Pawan Khera highlighted concerns about the selective enforcement of laws, claiming opposition leaders are targeted while allies go unpunished.
  • Baghel also condemned RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's comments regarding India's independence, framing them as anti-constitutional.
“Why else do institutions like the ED seem to remember the addresses of only opposition leaders?” - Pawan Khera

This defense reflects ongoing tensions between the Congress party and the ruling government, centering on the integrity of democratic institutions in India.
newTitle: Congress Defends Rahul Gandhi's Remarks on 'Indian State'

title: 8th Pay Commission: How much pay hike can 1.15 crore central govt employees and pensioners expect? - Mint
summary:
8th Pay Commission: How much pay hike can 1.15 crore central govt employees and pensioners expect?

Publication Date: Not specified in the article
Source: Live Mint

The central government has announced the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission, which is expected to increase the salaries and pensions of over 1.15 crore individuals, including central government employees and pensioners.

  • Senior-level employees may see a basic pay rise of approximately 20%.
  • Employees at levels 1 to 5 are expected to receive about a 25% increase in basic pay.
  • Approximately 50 lakh central government employees, including defense personnel, will benefit from this decision.
  • Another 65 lakh pensioners are also expected to receive benefits from the new pay structure.
  • The last pay commission resulted in a minimum basic pay increase from ₹7,000 to ₹18,000; the new commission might increase it dramatically to ₹51,480 per month.
  • Changes to retirement benefits such as EPF and gratuity may also occur as a result of the 8th Pay Commission.
“The increase in the minimum basic pay will be an astonishing 186 percent.” – Rohitaashv Sinha, King Stubb & Kasiva law firm

This new pay commission has implications not only for salary adjustments but potentially for future pension calculations and government employee salary structures.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission: Expected Salary Hikes for Central Government Employees and Pensioners

title: Bengaluru: Woman Techie Immolates Self After Alleging Harassment By Uncle, Dies - News18
Mahakumbh 2025: IMD predicts rain, fog in Prayagraj, sounds orange alert - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: IMD Predicts Rain and Fog in Prayagraj, Issues Orange Alert

Date: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an Orange alert for Prayagraj as the Mahakumbh progresses with an expected chance of rain and fog.

  • Over 30 lakh devotees participated on the fourth day of the Mahakumbh.
  • IMD has indicated weather changes including potential rainfall and temperature drops.
  • Rainfall of 13 cm was reported in Tirunelveli.
“There is a possibility of rain and fog conditions today in southeast UP, where the Kumbh Mela is currently going on.” - IMD Scientist Soma Sen Roy

This alert highlights the weather conditions that may affect the massive gathering of devotees at the Mahakumbh in Prayagraj.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: IMD Predicts Rain and Fog in Prayagraj, Issues Orange Alert

title: Blackmailed by close relative over nude photos, Bengaluru techie ends life - Daijiworld.com
J&K based Officer Haamid Bukhari among 11 picked as Regional Nodal Officer to implement Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme - Cross Town News
summary:
Haamid Bukhari Named Regional Nodal Officer for PM's Internship Scheme

Date: January 16, 2024Source: Cross Town News

The Ministry of Corporate Affairs has appointed 11 officers, including Haamid Bukhari from J&K, to implement the Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme, aimed at providing one crore internship opportunities in top companies over five years.

  • 11 officers appointed as Regional Nodal Officers for PMIS.
  • Haamid Bukhari will oversee the Northern Region including J&K, Himachal Pradesh, and Delhi.
  • The scheme aims to create 1.25 lakh internships for FY 2024-25 as a pilot project.
  • Internships are designed to bridge the gap between academic learning and industry requirements.
  • The initiative is independent of existing skill development programs.
“This scheme aims to provide exposure to youth in real-life business environments,” said a ministry spokesperson.

This initiative represents a significant effort to enhance the employability of youth through practical experience and is expected to have a lasting impact on job readiness in the region.
newTitle: Haamid Bukhari Named Regional Nodal Officer for PM's Internship Scheme

title: 17 Naxalites killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur - Hindustan Times
17 Naxalites killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur - Hindustan Times
12 Naxalites killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur - Hindustan Times
summary:
17 Naxalites Killed in Encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

As many as 17 Naxalites were killed during an anti-Naxalite operation in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district.

  • The encounter began around 9 am on Thursday in a forested area and continued until late evening.
  • This month, the total Naxalites killed in encounters in Chhattisgarh has reached 26.
  • No casualties were reported among security forces involved in the operation.
“As per preliminary information, 12 Naxalites were killed in the gunfight. Further details were awaited as a search operation was still underway.”

The government has affirmed its commitment to countering Naxalism effectively in the region.
newTitle: 17 Naxalites Killed in Encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur

title: J&K based Officer Haamid Bukhari picked as Regional Nodal Officer to implement Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme - Cross Town News
summary:
J&K Officer Haamid Bukhari Appointed as Regional Nodal Officer for PM Internship Scheme

Date: January 16, 2024   Source: Cross Town News

The Indian government has designated 11 officers as Regional Nodal Officers for the Prime Minister’s Internship Scheme (PMIS), aiming to provide internships to one crore youth in top companies.

  • Haamid Bukhari has been selected for the Northern Region, covering several states and UTs.
  • The PMIS will offer internship opportunities in top 500 companies over five years.
  • The scheme aims to bridge the gap between academic learning and industry requirements.
  • A pilot project targeting 1.25 lakh internship opportunities will launch in FY 2024-25.
  • Participation from companies is voluntary and based on CSR expenditure.
“The Scheme is separate from all existing skill development and internship programs.”

This initiative marks a significant step in enhancing employability and providing real-life experience to youth across India.
newTitle: J&K Officer Haamid Bukhari Appointed as Regional Nodal Officer for PM Internship Scheme

title: Armed burglars who pulled off ATM robbery in Bidar fire at cops in Hyderabad’s Afzalgunj - Telangana Today
summary:
Armed Burglars Who Pulled Off ATM Robbery in Bidar Fire at Cops in Hyderabad's Afzalgunj

Updated On - 16 January 2025

Hyderabad: Panic spread in the busy Afzalgunj area of Hyderabad after a gang of burglars reportedly fired upon a police team on Wednesday evening. The interstate gang was involved in a previous heist in Bidar, Karnataka, where they killed two security guards.

  • The Bidar police formed special teams to apprehend the gang after the incident.
  • On a tip-off, police identified gang members at Afzalgunj and attempted to apprehend them.
  • One burglar fired upon the police, resulting in injuries.
  • The injured individual was taken to Osmania General Hospital for treatment.

More details awaited.
newTitle: Armed Burglars Involved in ATM Heist Fire at Police in Hyderabad

title: 12 Maoists gunned down by security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur district - The Hindu
summary:
Maoist Encounter in Chhattisgarh: 12 Killed in Major Operation

Date: January 16, 2025
Source: The Hindu

In a significant anti-Naxal operation, security forces killed at least twelve Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district. This action follows an IED blast that resulted in the loss of eight security personnel's lives.

  • The operation took place in the South Bastar region, which encompasses Bijapur, Dantewada, and Sukma districts.
  • The encounter started after a tip-off about the Maoist presence in a forested area.
  • A joint team from multiple security contingents engaged in intermittent gunfire with the Maoists throughout the day.
  • No casualties were reported on the side of the security forces.
  • This encounter marks a rise in anti-Naxal operations in 2024, with a total of 26 Maoists reported killed in encounters this year.
“There has been an upsurge in anti-Naxal operations since the end of 2023.”

The operation underscores the ongoing challenges faced by security forces in combating Maoist insurgency in the region.
newTitle: Maoist Encounter in Chhattisgarh: 12 Killed in Major Operation

title: ‘Arvind Kejriwal fears defeat’: BJP's Parvesh Verma on charges of giving away shoes to voters - Hindustan Times
Delhi Assembly election 2025: BJP names nine more candidates in fourth list of candidates - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Names Nine More Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

Published on: January 16, 2025, Source: The Hindu

The BJP has announced nine more candidates for the upcoming 2025 Delhi Assembly elections, fielding key contenders against AAP leaders in various constituencies.

  • The BJP has now named a total of 68 candidates for the elections.
  • Shikha Rai and Anil Vashishth are among the candidates announced, contesting from Greater Kailash and Babarpur respectively.
  • Shikha Rai will compete against AAP minister Saurabh Bharadwaj.
  • Anil Vashishth will face Gopal Rai, another AAP minister.
  • JD(U) has also announced Shailendra Kumar as its candidate for the Burari constituency.
  • The elections are scheduled for February 5, with vote counting on February 8.
“The BJP is pulling out all the stops to end the AAP's 10-year-long reign in the national capital.”

The upcoming elections are pivotal for the BJP as it aims to challenge the longstanding dominance of AAP in Delhi.
newTitle: BJP Names Nine More Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

title: Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Which classes are suspended in these areas? - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Which Classes Are Suspended?

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The North India region is currently facing a severe cold wave, prompting the closure of schools in Delhi NCR for physical classes, with various updates on class schedules and modes of instruction.

  • Schools in Noida have suspended classes from nursery to Class 8 until January 17.
  • Classes 9 and 11 will transition to a hybrid learning model.
  • The Directorate of Education has mandated hybrid classes for up to Class 9 and Class 11 due to poor air quality.
  • The air quality index (AQI) in the region has risen significantly, leading to stage four restrictions being invoked under the Graded Response Action Plan.
“All heads of government, government-aided, unaided private schools under DoE, NDMC, MCD, and the Delhi Cantonment Board are directed to conduct hybrid classes for students up to Class 9 and 11, wherever online learning is feasible.”

The decision aims to ensure students' safety amid increasing air pollution and health risks associated with low temperatures and foggy weather.
newTitle: Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Which Classes Are Suspended?

8th Pay Commission for central government employees approved by Cabinet - Hindustan Times
summary:
8th Pay Commission: Central Government Employees

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Union Cabinet approved the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission to revise the salaries of central government employees and the allowances of pensioners.

  • The approval was made in a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • There are over 49 lakh central government employees and nearly 65 lakh pensioners affected by this decision.
  • The Commission will have a chairman and two members, who will be appointed soon.
  • Consultations will be held with various stakeholders, including central and state governments.
  • The 7th Pay Commission was established in 2016 and its term will conclude in 2026.
“A pay commission is constituted by the central government once every decade to revise the salary structure of its employees.”

The formation of the 8th Pay Commission aims to address the increasing salary and pension demands of central government employees, which will significantly impact their economic well-being.
newTitle: Union Cabinet Approves 8th Pay Commission for Central Government Employees

title: 1896 born Swami Sivananda has attended every Kumbh Mela in 100 years - Deccan Herald
summary:
Swami Sivananda: Attending Kumbh Mela for 100 Years

Published: 16 January 2025, Source: Unknown

Swami Sivananda Baba, a Padma Shri recipient, has been attending every Kumbh Mela across various locations in India for the past century, showcasing his dedication and spiritual journey.

  • Born on August 8, 1896, to a beggar's family, he was raised by Saint Omkarananda Goswami after losing his family.
  • Swami Sivananda has maintained a rigorous lifestyle focused on yoga and meditation, consuming minimal food and maintaining a strict daily routine.
  • He has been recognized for his spiritual abilities and received the Padma Shri without applying for it, being praised by devotees and officials alike.
  • His teachings emphasize the importance of yoga and maintaining a healthy lifestyle among the youth.
“Start your day early and dedicate at least half-an-hour to yoga. Maintain a proper lifestyle.” - Swami Sivananda

Swami Sivananda’s life story is a testament to resilience and spiritual dedication, influencing many through his teachings.
newTitle: Swami Sivananda: Attending Kumbh Mela for 100 Years

title: Congress Moves Supreme Court In Support Of Places Of Worship Act - News18
Singapore President to visit Odisha: Traffic restrictions imposed in Bhubaneswar for two days, check the roads and timing you shouldn’t travel - Kalinga TV
summary:
Traffic Restrictions in Bhubaneswar for Singapore President's Visit

Date: January 17-18, 2025, Source: Bhubaneswar Cuttack Police Commissionerate

In light of the upcoming visit by Singapore President Tharman Shanmugaratnam, the Bhubaneswar Cuttack Police have implemented traffic restrictions in the city over two days to facilitate the event.

  • No vehicles will be allowed on several key routes during specified times.
  • The traffic advisory applies particularly to major thoroughfares and intersections related to the presidential visit.
  • Emergency vehicles will be exempt from these restrictions.

To minimize disruption, the public is advised to plan their travel routes in advance to navigate around these areas.
newTitle: Traffic Restrictions in Bhubaneswar for Singapore President's Visit

title: Places of Worship Act: 139-year-old Congress moves Supreme Court to defend the Act of 1991 - The Hindu
summary:
Places of Worship Act: 139-year-old Congress moves Supreme Court to defend the Act of 1991

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Indian National Congress has moved the Supreme Court to defend the Places of Worship Act of 1991, emphasizing its significance for secularism and communal harmony in India.

  • The Act preserves the character of religious places as of August 15, 1947.
  • The Congress argues the Act reflects the mandate of the Indian populace.
  • Concerns raised about the implications of altering the Act on national integrity.
  • The INC was a principal architect when the Act was passed in the 10th Lok Sabha.
  • The Act protects the rights to freedom of religion and ensures the secular state’s obligations.
“The POWA is essential to safeguard secularism in India and the present challenge appears to be a motivated and malicious attempt to undermine established principles of secularism.” - INC

The Congress seeks to emphasize the law's constitutional significance and prevent potential disruptions to India's secular framework.
newTitle: Congress Defends Places of Worship Act in Supreme Court
